alert.note: Alert for Darlington; Dillon; Florence; Marion; Northern Horry; Williamsburg (South Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wilmington (Northeastern South Carolina and Southeastern North Carolina - Wilmington)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 27 at 2:36AM EDT by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Florence, southern Dillon, southeastern Darlington, northwestern Horry, Marion and north central Williamsburg Counties through 315 AM EDT... At 234 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms extending from 7 miles east of Gapway to near Hebron. Movement was east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Florence, Marion, Dillon, Lake City, Mullins, Timmonsville, Latta, Pamplico, Quinby, Lake View, Sellers, Fork, Blue Brick, Zion, Mars Bluff, Gapway, Cartersville, Rains, Gresham and New Hope. This includes the following highways... Interstate 20 between mile markers 140 and 141. Interstate 95 in South Carolina between mile markers 148 and 164, and near mile marker 170. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. These storms may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.

area.areaDesc: Darlington; Dillon; Florence; Marion; Northern Horry; Williamsburg
